intro: Stachyophorbe pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf stachyophorbe, is a small, mat-forming succulent native to arid regions of southern Africa. It features dense, fleshy leaves that are typically green or blue-gray in color, adapted to store water. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers during the cooler months, which are clustered in inflorescences. Its compact growth habit makes it well-suited for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Due to its slow growth and specific habitat requirements, it is relatively rare and often found in rocky or sandy soils.
